titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Margaret Miller Papers, 1916-1971
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Archives and Special Collections Library.

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Jason Kovari, 20 Feb 2009

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: The Margaret Miller Papers include correspondence with visual and literary artists as well as photographs and an art booklet. Correspondents include Elizabeth Bishop, Lloyd Frankenberg, Loren McIver, and Frani Blough.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Margaret Miller (VC 1934) roomed with Elizabeth Bishop while a student at Vassar. An art historian and painter, Miller lost her arm in an automobile accident in France in 1937 while vacationing with Bishop and Louise Crane. Later, Miller served as a staff member at the Museum of Modern Art in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: 2 photographs of Miller, an art booklet and several postcards to and from Miller. Correspondents include Elizabeth Bishop, Lloyd Frankenberg, Loren McIver, and Frani Blough.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Wallis, Michael The Real Wild West separated from this collection and offered to the Main Library, Jan 2008.

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Finding aid encoded by Jason Kovari, 20 Feb 2009.

processinfo.p: Collection processed by Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library, 8 Jan 2008.

prefercite.p: Margaret Miller Papers, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.
